cons: Some lengthy driving to visit patients

job_title: Marketing and Communications in White River Junction, VT
pros: Honestly, I can't think of many. Anything that I thought was a Pro in the beginning got twisted and ended up not being remotely worth it.
cons: Ridiculous standards and nitpicking when it comes to dress code or even where to wear your badge. An overwhelming amount of work and little to no help in organizing and very little to no training. Absolutely no compassion or flexibility in regards to dealing with personal matters and trying to get work done. I was constantly thrown under the bus and bullied by my manager only to be unceremoniously discarded when they merged with Dartmouth. Basically for a company whose mission is helping people, they completely fail when it comes to their support staff.

cons: Only benefit for a 24 hour salaried position is Earned Time Off. No advancement opportunities.
